The Engine class is the main driver of the game It initializes the game environment including the game description parser and window It also handles the execution of the game by displaying the start description room name and room description
Constructs an Engine object with a specified game description game The game description to be used for this engine instance
The main method to start the game It creates an Engine instance with a SpaceEscape game description and executes the game args the command line arguments not used
Executes the game by setting up the window displaying the start description and showing the current room s name and description
Abstract class representing the game description It serves as a blueprint for creating specific game instances defining the common structure and behavior of the game
Returns the welcome message for the game This method must be implemented by subclasses The welcome message as a String
Sets the current room based on the provided room ID roomId ID of the room to set as the current room
Sets the flag indicating whether a key has been used in the game keyUsed true to indicate the key has been used false otherwise
Returns the player s inventory List of AdvObject objects in the player s inventory
Returns the current room where the player is located Current Room object
Adds an object to the list of all objects in the game obj The AdvObject to add
(int roomId, List< Integer > inventoryIds, boolean monsterAlive, boolean isDoorOpen)

Sets up the game state based on the provided parameters roomId ID of the current room inventoryIds List of IDs for objects in the player s inventory monsterAlive Flag indicating if the monster is alive isDoorOpen Flag indicating if a door is open
Returns the list of commands available in the game List of Command objects
Retrieves an object by its ID from the list of all objects in the game id The ID of the object to retrieve An Optional containing the AdvObject if found or an empty Optional otherwise
Returns whether a key has been used in the game true if the key has been used false otherwise
Initializes the game This method must be implemented by subclasses Exception if an error occurs during initialization
Sets the current room where the player is located currentRoom The Room object to set as the current room

Processes the player s next move based on the parsed input and updates the game state accordingly This method must be implemented by subclasses p The parsed player input window The game window for displaying output
Returns the list of rooms in the game List of Room objects
Utility class containing helper methods for game operations

Searches for an object in the player s inventory by its ID inventory The list of AdvObject representing the player s inventory id The unique identifier of the object to search for The AdvObject if found in the inventory otherwise returns
Utility class providing static methods for common operations such as loading a list of strings from a file into a set and parsing strings into a list of tokens

Parses a given string into a list of tokens words excluding any tokens that are contained in a provided set of stopwords This method is useful for text processing tasks such as tokenization string The string to parse stopwords A Set of stopwords to exclude from the resulting list of tokens A List of tokens derived from the input string excluding any stopwords

Loads each line from a specified file into a Set of strings This method is useful for loading data where each line represents a unique entry such as a list of stopwords file The file to read from A Set containing all lines from the file trimmed and converted to lowercase IOException If an I/O error occurs reading from the file
This class is designed to play sound files in a separate thread It supports basic operations such as play stop and handling of audio pan left right normal
This class provides database operations for the adventure game It handles connections to the database and provides methods to retrieve and update game data
Retrieves the name associated with a given ID from the database id The ID for which the name is to be retrieved The name associated with the ID or null if not found or in case of an error

Updates the room look associated with a given ID in the database id The ID for which the room look is to be updated newRoomLook The new room look to be set true if the update was successful false otherwise

Updates the description associated with a given ID in the database id The ID for which the description is to be updated newDescription The new description to be set true if the update was successful false otherwise
Updates the name associated with a given ID in the database id The ID for which the name is to be updated newName The new name to be set true if the update was successful false otherwise
Constructor for Database Initializes the database connection using JDBC and H2 database

Retrieves the description associated with a given ID from the database id The ID for which the description is to be retrieved The description associated with the ID or null if not found or in case of an error
Inserts new data into the database by prompting the user for input Data includes ID name description and room look true if the data was successfully inserted false otherwise

Retrieves the room look associated with a given ID from the database id The ID for which the room look is to be retrieved The room look associated with the ID or null if not found or in case of an error
Implements the observer for inventory-related events in the game This observer is responsible for handling the display of the player s inventory when the inventory command is issued

Updates the game state in response to an inventory command and generates a message describing the current contents of the player s inventory description The current state of the game parserOutput The output from the command parser containing the parsed command window The game window where output messages are displayed A string message detailing the contents of the player s inventory or a message indicating the inventory is empty if no items are present

Observer implementation for handling commands within the game This observer checks if the player can kill a monster in the current room based on the presence of a weapon in the player s inventory and the monster s existence

Processes a command determining if the player successfully kills a monster in the current room The method checks if the player is in the correct room if the monster is alive and if the player has the required weapon If the conditions are met the monster is killed and a success message is returned Otherwise appropriate messages are returned based on the failure condition e.g no monster no weapon description The current state of the game including rooms inventory and game objects parserOutput The parsed output of the player s command including the command type and arguments window The game window where output messages are displayed A string message indicating the outcome of the command
Observer implementation for handling commands within the game This observer is responsible for providing descriptions of the current room or objects within it when the player uses the command

Processes a command returning a description of the current room or an object within it If the current room has a special description it is returned otherwise a generic message is provided description The current state of the game including the player s current room parserOutput The parsed output of the player s command including the command type and arguments window The game window where output messages are displayed A string message containing the description of the current room or a generic message if the room has no special description
Observer implementation for handling movement commands within the game This observer updates the player s current room based on the direction specified in the command

Processes movement commands NORTH SOUTH EAST WEST updating the player s current room accordingly If the movement is not possible e.g a wall blocks the way it returns a message indicating so Otherwise it silently updates the player s current room to the new location description The current state of the game including the player s current room parserOutput The parsed output of the player s command including the command type and arguments window The game window where output messages are displayed A string message indicating the outcome of the movement command or an empty string if the movement was successful

Observer implementation for handling commands within the game This observer allows players to open objects or containers in the game environment potentially revealing or releasing items contained within

Attempts to open a specified object or container If the object is an instance of AdvObjectContainer and contains items those items are moved to the current room Messages are generated to inform the player of the action s outcome msg The StringBuilder object used to build the outcome message description The current state of the game including the player s current room object The object or container to be opened

Processes an command attempting to open the specified object or container If the object is openable and not already open it is opened and any contained items are moved to the current room Messages are generated to inform the player of the action s outcome description The current state of the game including the player s current room and inventory parserOutput The parsed output of the player s command including the command type and targeted object window The game window where output messages are displayed A string message indicating the outcome of the command
Observer implementation for handling commands within the game This observer allows players to pick up objects from the current room and add them to their inventory provided the objects are pickupable

Processes a command attempting to add the specified object to the player s inventory Verifies if the object is present in the current room and if it is pickupable If successful the object is removed from the room and added to the inventory and a success message is returned Otherwise an appropriate failure message is generated description The current state of the game including the player s current room and inventory parserOutput The parsed output of the player s command including the command type and targeted object window The game window where output messages are displayed A string message indicating the outcome of the command
Represents the data of a player in the game including their name the date and the time This class is used to manage player-specific information that can be utilized throughout the game
Sets the player s name name The new name of the player
Gets the player s name The name of the player
Returns a string representation of the player data including name date and time A string representation of the player data
Sets the date associated with the player s current state or progress date The new date related to the player s progress or state

Constructs a new PlayerData instance with specified name date and time name The name of the player date The date related to the player s progress or state time The time related to the player s progress or state
Sets the time associated with the player s current state or progress time The new time related to the player s progress or state
Gets the time associated with the player s current state or progress The time related to the player s progress or state
Gets the date associated with the player s current state or progress The date related to the player s progress or state
Observer implementation for handling commands within the game This observer allows players to interact with objects that can be pushed triggering specific game events or actions

Processes a command performing actions based on the object being pushed If the object is pushable it triggers specific events such as activating a control panel or requiring further input from the player Messages are generated to inform the player of the action s outcome or next steps description The current state of the game including the player s current room and inventory parserOutput The parsed output of the player s command including the command type and targeted object window The game window where output messages are displayed and interactive elements may be shown A string message indicating the outcome of the command or further instructions for the player

Verifies if the given input matches a specific pattern typically used for validating codes or inputs in the game This method is used to check if the player has entered a correct access code or similar input input The string input to be verified against the pattern true if the input matches the pattern false otherwise

A client for interacting with a RESTful service specifically designed for managing a game s leaderboard This client allows for adding player data to the leaderboard and retrieving the current leaderboard standings

Adds a player s data to the leaderboard by sending a PUT request to the RESTful service The player s data is serialized to JSON format before being sent player The player data to add to the leaderboard

Retrieves the current leaderboard standings by sending a GET request to the RESTful service The response is deserialized from JSON format into a human-readable string A string representation of the leaderboard standings
Constructs a new RESTClient instance initializing the REST client target URL and Gson parser
Observer implementation for handling commands within the game This observer allows players to read objects that contain readable content such as maps or notes

Processes a command displaying the content of the readable object to the player It checks if the object is in the player s inventory or in the current room and if it is readable If the object is a map it provides additional handling description The current state of the game including the player s current room and inventory parserOutput The parsed output of the player s command including the command type and targeted object window The game window where output messages are displayed A string message indicating the outcome of the command such as the content of the object or an error message
Provides functionality to save and load game states to and from a file This class includes methods to save the current game state check if a game save exists and load a game state from a file

Loads the game state from a file based on the specified game name This method reads the file and constructs a map containing the game state including elapsed seconds current room monster alive status door open status and player inventory gameName The name of the game to load A map containing the loaded game state
Checks if a game save with the specified name already exists in the file gameName The name of the game to check true if the game exists false otherwise
(Room currentRoom, List< AdvObject > inventory, String gameName, int elapsedSeconds, boolean monsterAlive, boolean isDoorOpen)

Saves the current game state to a file This includes the current room player inventory game name elapsed time monster alive status and door open status If a game with the same name already exists the save is aborted currentRoom The current room the player is in inventory The current inventory of the player gameName The name of the game save elapsedSeconds The elapsed time in seconds since the game started monsterAlive The alive status of the monster isDoorOpen The open status of the door
Main class for the SpaceEscape game extending GameDescription and implementing GameObservable This class initializes the game environment including rooms objects and commands and handles player moves

Processes the next move based on the player s command This method updates the game state notifies observers and displays messages to the player p The parsed output of the player s command window The game window where messages are displayed
Attaches an observer to the game Observers are notified of game events and can update the game state or display messages o The observer to attach
Returns the welcome message to be displayed at the start of the game The welcome message string
Initializes the game environment using data from the provided database This includes setting up rooms commands objects and observers Exception If there is an error accessing the database
Detaches an observer from the game o The observer to detach
Notifies all attached observers of a game event Observers can update the game state or generate messages based on the event window The game window where messages may be displayed
Observer implementation for handling commands within the game This observer allows players to interact with objects by using them triggering specific game events or actions

Updates the game state based on the player s input This observer handles the command allowing players to interact with objects by using them description The current game description parserOutput The output of the parser containing the command and the objects involved window The game window A message describing the result of the interaction
The main window for the adventure game providing the graphical user interface This class extends JFrame incorporating various UI components to interact with the game
Retrieves the text currently inserted by the player The text inserted by the player
Displays the starting description of the game in a text area startDescription The starting description text

Constructs the main game window initializing UI components and setting up event listeners game The game description containing the state and logic of the adventure game parser The parser used to interpret player commands
Updates and displays the description of the current room in a text area roomDescription The description of the current room
Displays a message in a text area typically used for feedback or game instructions message The message to display
Updates and displays the name of the current room in a text area roomName The name of the current room
Fetches and displays the leaderboard from a RESTful service

The Parser class is responsible for interpreting player commands within the game It processes input strings removing stopwords and identifies commands and objects mentioned in the input It supports simple sentences structured as with articles and prepositions being ignored
Constructs a Parser with a specified set of stopwords stopwords A set of strings representing stopwords to be ignored during parsing
(String command, List< Command > commands, List< AdvObject > objects, List< AdvObject > inventory)

Parses a player command identifying the command and objects mentioned in the input command The player command to parse commands A list of commands to check against objects A list of objects to check against inventory A list of objects in the player s inventory to check against A ParserOutput object containing the identified command and objects
Checks if a token is a command token The token to check commands A list of commands to check against The index of the command in the list or 1 if the token is not a command
(int id, String name, String description, Set< String > alias)
(int id, String name, String description, Set< String > alias)
Represents a command in the adventure game Commands are actions that the player can perform such as moving picking up items or interacting with the game world
Sets the aliases for the command alias A set of alternative names or aliases for the command
Returns the primary name of the command The primary name of the command

Compares this command to another object for equality Two commands are considered equal if they have the same type obj The object to compare with this command true if the specified object is a command with the same type false otherwise
(CommandType type, String name, Set< String > alias)

Constructs a Command with a specified type name and set of aliases This constructor allows for the initialization of a command with multiple names type The type of the command name The primary name of the command alias A set of alternative names or aliases for the command
Returns the set of aliases for the command A set of alternative names or aliases for the command
Constructs a Command with a specified type and name This constructor initializes a command without any aliases type The type of the command name The primary name of the command
Sets the aliases for the command from an array of strings This method converts the array into a set and assigns it to the command alias An array of alternative names or aliases for the command
Returns the type of the command The type of the command
Generates a hash code for the command The hash code is based primarily on the command s type A hash code for the command

Represents a room within the adventure game A room can have various properties such as a name description visibility connections to other rooms north south east west and objects within it Rooms can also contain a monster and have dynamic descriptions based on game state
(int id, String name, String description, GameDescription game)

Constructs a Room with a specified ID name description and a reference to the game description id The unique identifier for the room name The name of the room description The static description of the room game The game description providing access to global game state

Generates a dynamic description of the room including details about objects and their states For example if a reinforced door object ID 9 is open this is reflected in the description A string representing the dynamic look of the room
Adds an object to the room If the object s ID is not 6 it is added to the room s object list and the global game object list obj The object to add to the room

Constructs a Room with a specified ID and a reference to the game description This constructor initializes a room without a name or a static description id The unique identifier for the room game The game description providing access to global game state
